name: sfchronicle
text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
George Floyd protest updates: SFPD begin lining up against boarded-up buildings early Sunday evening on Market Street near the Powell cable car turnaround and at the Westfield Center in an apparent attempt to discourage destructive protests and looting.

https://t.co/L5kcXBXMZD

name: sfchronicle
text:
More than a thousand people walk down San Francisco's Market Street, chanting ‚ÄúNo justice! No Peace!‚Äù 

Reporter @TrishaThadani describes the scene as energetic and peaceful.

Live updates: https://t.co/yo4wAY4SI0 https://t.co/qTxe0aksTC

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @lizziejohnsonnn: A peaceful march down San Francisco‚Äôs Market Street (about two hours before curfew). Motorists on Third Street are honking in support. Hundreds of police officers line either side of the street, along with Sheriff‚Äôs deputies from as far as Mariposa. https://t.co/AWhs8s8F98A peaceful march down San Francisco‚Äôs Market Street (about two hours before curfew). Motorists on Third Street are‚Ä¶ https://t.co/tOyVCWizLe

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @lizziejohnsonnn: The march is loud with drumbeats and chanting. The police follow close behind, passerbyers heckling them as they go. Every time they stop, officers at the end of the line stand back to back. https://t.co/mwLw2V7UegThe march is loud with drumbeats and chanting. The police follow close behind, passerbyers heckling them as they go‚Ä¶ https://t.co/VxBP3Cgg8Y

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @lizziejohnsonnn: Paired up with @TrishaThadani tonight to cover San Francisco and its curfew ‚Äî and anything else that might happen. name: sfchronicle
text: LATEST: A San Jose Police officer has been taken off street duty after a video of him cursing at protesters went viral on social media, San Jose Mayor Sam Liccardo said in a Sunday news conference. https://t.co/HuDXiVvgQ0

name: sfchronicle
text: LIVE UPDATES: A crowd of about 50 people, many dressed in black and carrying backpacks, were trying to break into Best Buy in Pleasant Hill. No police were visible. https://t.co/nrXjXq8ppZ

name: sfchronicle
text: BREAKING: Walnut Creek issues 6:00 p.m. curfew for today and asks all businesses downtown to close immediately due to civil unrest. https://t.co/vhcAoYSV2V

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @TrishaThadani: About 1,000 ppl here at SF City Hall. Speaker yelling through a megaphone: ‚ÄúThis is family. This is the family that is going to bring the revolution.‚Äù https://t.co/G3ybNDW8PnAbout 1,000 ppl here at SF City Hall. Speaker yelling through a megaphone: ‚ÄúThis is family. This is the family that‚Ä¶ https://t.co/zypMH4Q9ja

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @lizziejohnsonnn: About 1,000 people gathered outside of San Francisco City Hall. Speakers with blow horns said that this was a ‚Äúrevolution‚Äù and that we ‚Äúare living right now.‚Äù Everyone quietly rose their fists in solidarity. 

A woman lit palo santo to cleanse the air: ‚ÄúWe need that right now.‚Äù https://t.co/gQbAoM2jWsAbout 1,000 people gathered outside of San Francisco City Hall. Speakers with blow horns said that this was a ‚Äúrevo‚Ä¶ https://t.co/IPSP0Q72zy

name: sfchronicle
text:
‚ÄùFist up, Fight back‚Äù: In Sacramento, protesters chant as they prepare to march.

The demonstration is peaceful and there is heavy CHP presence, reports @DustinGardiner.

Live updates: https://t.co/yo4wAY4SI0 https://t.co/2XvbumZuOv

text: ‚ÄúThe area is not safe.‚Äù Protests resumed in Oakland before dark Sunday as demonstrators faced off with police. https://t.co/Ue1fVzhRtk

text: Latest from San Francisco: People knelt in front of the City Hall building, yelling at police officers who were just outside the building, ‚ÄúTake a knee! Take a knee!‚Äù https://t.co/U0xAq0HjOn

name: sfchronicle
text: Worries about consumer confidence following widespread protests weighed on shares Monday morning. The Dow dropped 0.5% as more than half of a group of chief financial officers surveyed by CNBC said they expected shares to drop to 19,000 before rebounding. https://t.co/RChs1uqo1l https://t.co/c2trO3Dk4R

text: Oakland police arrested three people early Monday who were suspected of shooting at the department‚Äôs headquarters.  https://t.co/6WoREJokZ9 https://t.co/DwODvYasgh

text: Today's front page: the stories San Francisco is talking about this morning. https://t.co/sgK7iFvtYo https://t.co/kEtnOa9El6

name: sfchronicle
text: The cost of renting an apartment in the Bay Area plummeted in May, as layoffs and the increased flexibility of working from home drove a double-digit drop in some of the nation‚Äôs most expensive housing markets. https://t.co/9043l6oscq

name: sfchronicle
text: Authorities in Walnut Creek on Monday urged people to avoid downtown and suggested businesses not open as they monitor potential protests and reports of ‚Äúviolence and looting.‚Äù https://t.co/Zfa4n0UfmM https://t.co/S4si0Xbqp8

name: sfchronicle
text: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a dramatic drop in San Francisco and the South Bay. This is real. We have never seen anything like it.‚Äù https://t.co/9cgCCfirRe

name: sfchronicle
text: ‚ÄúPre-pandemic, it was bad enough. But now that we‚Äôre in the pandemic, black people are getting messed up even more ‚Äî getting infected in bigger numbers than others, having to go to work more than others and get exposed.‚Äù https://t.co/KoTnvjnSux

name: sfchronicle
text: Officials in San Leandro enacted a nightly curfew set to go into effect at 6 p.m. Monday as they declared a local state of emergency due to ‚Äúcivil unrest‚Äù in the city and East Bay. Storefronts in San Leandro were hit hard by looters Sunday, police said. https://t.co/oFscLhZrSq https://t.co/sazAnNpXsy

name: sfchronicle
text: SF D.A. Chesa Boudin and Contra Costa County D.A. Diana Becton joined a coalition calling on the State Bar to create a rule that would block prosecutors and those seeking office from accepting endorsements or financial support from law enforcement unions. https://t.co/uknQaKUeA0 https://t.co/ATKG2swafW

text: The drag performers wore sequins and glitter and feathers. And hour after hour after hour, they eulogized a place that, for many, felt more like more of a home than a bar. https://t.co/n2Hl6cIKf8

name: sfchronicle
text: An independent autopsy into the death of George Floyd found that he died of asphyxiation due to neck and back compression when a Minneapolis police officer held his knee on Floyd‚Äôs neck for several minutes and ignored his cries of distress. https://t.co/JUw1iDwjao

name: sfchronicle
text: Hundreds gathered in front of San Francisco City Hall on Monday to mourn those who died at the hands of police brutality. Follow for more live updates: https://t.co/zPjnVopb2H https://t.co/Sq25qnojm8

name: sfchronicle
text: From @sfchronicle's @otisrtaylorjr: "We‚Äôve got to talk more openly about race, because what happened to Floyd isn‚Äôt an isolated incident. The fragility of blackness hangs over my head every time I leave the house." https://t.co/Y8UsGMwPDl

text: Gov. Gavin Newsom said more than 4,500 men and women from the National Guard are available to be distributed throughout the state. Follow for more live updates: https://t.co/iN8lEFsgZs

name: sfchronicle
text: As a spate of recent police killings of black Americans and a weekend of intense protests have left the nation reeling, Rep. Barbara Lee is introducing legislation to create a commission to confront the legacy of slavery and racism in the U.S. https://t.co/pegJaEuAuy
